result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard G Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine ($404) and DNA surcharge are to be paid at $100 per month commencing 07-01-2015 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.  ALTERNATE:  14 days Waukesha County Jail with huber, all Standard Release Conditions with 1 day sentence credit.
DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid inclusive of fine payment plan.  DNA sample previously provided.
Court orders the firearm seized be forfeited and destroyed pursuant to statute.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard G Krueger

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Richard G Krueger in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty of the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Fine: $404
DNA Sample:  already provided.
DNA Surcharge:  $250
To be paid at the rate of $100 per month, starting 07/01/15 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 14 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - 1 Day Credit if imposed.
Court orders the firearm seized be forfeited and be destroyed pursuant to statute.
Court gave the felony warnings and prohibition of firearms.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Richard G Krueger in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz by Atty. Mark Powers.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard G Krueger in court.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting the court to appoint counsel. Court grants the request. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Richard G Krueger in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
